section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter governs the requirements for an infection control program in an EMS operational program.

para.text: Each EMS operational program shall designate an Infection Control Officer.
Duties of an EMS Operational Program Infection Control Officer. The EMS operational program Infection control officer shall be responsible for:
Implementing the EMS operational program infection control plan under Regulation .03 of this Chapter; and
Reporting occupational exposures to MIEMSS under COMAR 30.03.04.06.
Every EMS operational program shall have a written infection control plan.
The infection control plan shall include provisions for:
Labor and Employment Article, §5-702, Annotated Code of Maryland;
All other State and federal regulations as they pertain to infection control;
Post-exposure notice, testing, and treatment consistent with Health General Article, §18-338.3, Annotated Code of Maryland;
Ensuring that all EMS providers affiliated with the EMS operational program have notice of the plan and its contents; and

Training of all EMS providers affiliated with the EMS operational program in blood-borne pathogens, universal precautions, and infection control before assigning duties and at least annually thereafter.
